transcript.title: PM 126/1966 - PRIME MINISTER'S CHRISTMAS MESSAGE TO AUSTRALIAN FORCES
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P. M. No. 126/1966

PRIME MINISTER'S CHRISTMAS MESSAGE TO AUSTRALIAN FORCES

The Prime Minister, Mr. Holt has sent the followingÂ message to Australian servicemen and women at home andÂ overseas: " To all Australian servicemen and women I convey, asÂ Prime Minister, the thanks and appreciation of the Australian people,Â and their warmest good wishes for your well-being and happiness
through the time of Christmas and throughout the coming year.
Australia is grateful to you for the personal contribution you are
making to the security of the nation. Behind the shield of protection
which members of our fighting services and our allies provide, this nation
is able to advance steadily in strength and prosperity.
" Some of you are actively engaged in operations of war.
We have followed with pride the story of your exploits, a story brightened
by the gallantry and devotion to duty you have demonstrated. Those of
you who are absent from Australia, whether on military operations, on
other active duty or joining in the tasks that enable us to honour our
international obligations, all have a special place in our regard. This
is true at all times, but you are much in our thoughts at that time of
year when most of your fellow -Australians can happily enjoy the love
and companionship of their families. We hope this deprivation will be
softened in some degree for you by the knowledge that you have our
heartfelt gratitude. " May the coming year bring a just, honourable and enduring
peace enabling many of you to be united with your families again in
1967." 1 HAROLD HOLT,

PRIME MINISTER.
Canberra, 23rd December, 1966.
